revised_title: Solar Cycle and Quasi-Biennial Oscillation Impact on Earth's Climate
tldr: The authors discovered a probable association between the 11-year solar cycle and the quasi-biennial oscillation in atmospheric elements. They found that the solar signal in the middle atmosphere is more apparent in the westerly phase of the quasi-biennial oscillation. The study highlights the need for further investigation and confirmation of the solar-terrestrial relation through longer observation series.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate Science
